title: Ticket #565: Over long subject in Quill too-large-db email
description:
When Quill decides the database is too large, it sends email. It unhelpfully puts the entire message in the header, and nothing in the body. For example: 

Subject: Current database size (> 21509 MB) is
        bigger than 75 percent of the limit (20 GB). Please descrease
        the values of these parameters:
        QUILL_RESOURCE_HISTORY_DURATION, QUILL_RUN_HISTORY_DURATION,
        QUILL_JOB_HISTORY_DURATION or QUILL_DBSIZE_LIMIT

This is an automated email from the Condor system
on machine "north.cs.wisc.edu".  Do not reply.

The code in question is ManagedDatabase::PurgeDatabase() in ManageDatabase.cpp around line 254. The current code is: 

			email = email_admin_open(msg_body);

I believe it should look something like: 

                        char msg_subject[4000];
                        snprintf(msg_body, 4000,
                            "%s: Database too large (%d MB > 75% of %d GB)",
                            hostname_str, dssize, dbSizeLimit);
			email = email_admin_open(msg_subject);
                        fprintf(email, "%s", msg_body);

Finding hostname_str is left as an exercise to the implementer.
